name: LootBoxController
description: Allows users to plunder an address associated with an ERC721. Counterfactually instantiates a "Loot Box" at an address unique to an ERC721 token. The address for an ERC721 token can be computed and later plundered by transferring token balances to the ERC721 owner.

eventDecorators.name: Executed
eventDecorators.description: Emitted when a Loot Box is executed.

eventDecorators.name: Plundered
eventDecorators.description: Emitted when a Loot Box is plundered.

functionDecorators.name: computeAddress
functionDecorators.description: Computes the Loot Box address for a given ERC721 token. The contract will not exist yet, so the Loot Box address will have no code.

returnDecorators.description: The address of the Loot Box.

functionDecorators.name: executeCalls
functionDecorators.description: Allows the owner of an ERC721 to execute abitrary calls on behalf of the associated Loot Box. The Loot Box will be counterfactually created, calls executed, then the contract destroyed.

parameterDecorators.name: calls
parameterDecorators.description: The array of call structs that define that target, amount of ether, and data.

returnDecorators.description: The array of call return values.

functionDecorators.name: lootBoxInstance
functionDecorators.description: The instance to which all proxies will point.

functionDecorators.name: plunder
functionDecorators.description: Allows anyone to transfer all given tokens in a Loot Box to the associated ERC721 owner. A Loot Box contract will be counterfactually created, tokens transferred to the ERC721 owner, then destroyed.

parameterDecorators.name: erc20s
parameterDecorators.description: An array of ERC20 tokens whose entire balance should be transferred.

parameterDecorators.name: erc721s
parameterDecorators.description: An array of structs defining ERC721 tokens that should be transferred.

parameterDecorators.name: erc1155s
parameterDecorators.description: An array of struct defining ERC1155 tokens that should be transferred.
